snippet: As the insider trading case against Rajat K. Gupta heads toward trial, the prosecution and the defense are each seeking to gain the upper hand.
abstract: As the insider trading case against Rajat K. Gupta heads toward trial, the prosecution and the defense are each seeking to gain the upper hand.
lead_paragraph: We often think of prosecutions as involving a single crime that took place at a particular moment, so that the charges are fixed and the information that will be presented in court fairly clear-cut. In white-collar prosecutions, that is rarely the case, as prosecutors refine their case after filing charges, sometimes finding new violations, while defendants try to pry evidence from the government that can help their defense.

headline.main: Cat-and-Mouse Game in the Gupta Prosecution
